## Return Value

An integer identifying the table-view section associated with `indexTitleIndex`.

## Discussion

This method allows the table view to map between a given item in the section index and a given section even when there isn’t a one-to-one mapping. In its implementation of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSource/tableView(_:sectionForSectionIndexTitle:at:)], the data source can call this method on the indexed-collation object specifying as an argument the passed-in index integer; it then returns the result to the table view.

# section(forSectionIndexTitle:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the section that the table view should scroll to for the given index title.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func section(forSectionIndexTitle indexTitleIndex: Int) -> Int
```

## Parameters

- **indexTitleIndex**: An integer identifying a section-index title by its position in the array of such titles.

## Return Value

An integer identifying the table-view section associated with `indexTitleIndex`.

## Discussion

This method allows the table view to map between a given item in the section index and a given section even when there isn’t a one-to-one mapping. In its implementation of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSource/tableView(_:sectionForSectionIndexTitle:at:)], the data source can call this method on the indexed-collation object specifying as an argument the passed-in index integer; it then returns the result to the table view.

## Providing section index data to the table view

- **sectionTitles**: Returns the list of section titles for the table view.
- **sectionIndexTitles**: Returns the list of section-index titles for the table view.
